page.title: 20TRAVELLING
page.content: The only forms of public transport are the bus services, provided by the Southdown Bus Company and Brighton Borough Transport Service and various taxi companies. The coastal road, the A259, connects the area to Brighton in the west and to Newhaven in the east. The A259 is the busiest road with fairly heavy through traffic of all types.At peak times and in the season this causes some congestion, especially in Rottingdean. The only access to and from the north is provided by Falmer Road. Frequent bus services link Rottingdean and Woodingdean before turning westwards to Brighton. Bicycles are only for the young and fit. Cars are widely used.
